item.title: Serverless LLM Deployment Platform
item.author: hari@dasarpai.com (Dr. Hari Thapliyaal)
item.description:
Serverless LLM Deployment Platform
#

Microsoft’s Serverless LLM Deployment Platform
#

Azure OpenAI Service
#

Azure OpenAI Service is Microsoft’s answer to serverless LLM deployment. It provides access to powerful language models, including OpenAI’s GPT-4, GPT-3.5, Codex, and DALL-E, within the Azure ecosystem. It simplifies the process of integrating and deploying LLMs in a serverless manner.

item.title: Microsoft AI Products
item.author: hari@dasarpai.com (Dr. Hari Thapliyaal)
item.description:
Microsoft AI Products
#

Microsoft offers several tools and platforms for AI and machine learning, comparable to Google’s Vertex AI and Google AI Studio. These tools are integrated within Microsoft Azure, its cloud computing platform, and are designed for various user profiles, ranging from data scientists and ML engineers to business analysts and citizen developers.

item.title: Google AI Studio vs Vertex AI
item.author: hari@dasarpai.com (Dr. Hari Thapliyaal)
item.description:
Google AI Studio vs Vertex AI
#

The difference between Vertex AI and Google AI Studio lies in their scope, functionality, and target audiences within Google’s suite of AI tools.

1. Vertex AI
#

Vertex AI is Google’s end-to-end AI platform for machine learning (ML) and AI model development, training, deployment, and management. It is designed for developers and data scientists who want a comprehensive environment to build, deploy, and scale ML models.

item.title: Introduction to Container Registry
item.author: hari@dasarpai.com (Dr. Hari Thapliyaal)
item.description:
Introduction to Container Registry
#

What is Container Registry?
#

A container registry is a central store or service where container images are stored, managed and distributed. Container images are packaged applications that include the code, dependencies, libraries and configuration to run in any environment that supports containerization, like Docker or Kubernetes.

  • Vision
  • Speech

Generative AI
#

Generative AI is a fully managed Oracle Cloud Infrastructure service that provides a set of state-of-the-art, customizable large language models (LLMs) that cover a wide range of use cases, including chat, text generation, summarization, and creating text embeddings.

item.title: Exploring Google Firebase
item.author: hari@dasarpai.com (Dr. Hari Thapliyaal)
item.description:
Exploring Firebase
#

What is Firebase?
#

Originally, Firebase started as a product called Envolve in 2011, which was a real-time chat service. It was co-founded by James Tamplin and Andrew Lee. While developing Envolve, they realized that developers were using its real-time system to sync application data, not just chat messages. This led them to pivot and create Firebase as a real-time database product in 2012. Google acquired Firebase in 2014 and integrated it into its broader ecosystem, expanding it into a full-fledged platform for app development.

item.title: Google Cloud APIs
item.author: hari@dasarpai.com (Dr. Hari Thapliyaal)
item.description:
Google Cloud APIs
#

Introduction
#

Hundreds of services from Google are available to consumers as API. Every API has a specific purpose. Over a period of time, google keeps clubbing these API endpoints (a url/place where a service is available), cleaning their code and improving the capabilities of these services. Therefore, sometimes it looks endpoint or pip package is the same, but its API name is different. Recently when google clubbed their many AI APIs they are moved under VertexAI and API endpoint changed to aiplatform.googleapi.com. To bring some clarity for my own sake and some of you may like this, I wrote this article.

item.title: Database and Analytics Product Services from Google Azure AWS
item.author: hari@dasarpai.com (Dr. Hari Thapliyaal)
item.description:
Database and Analytics Product Services from Google Azure AWS
#

Database Tools/Services
#

Sno Amazon Azure Microsoft
1. Amazon Aurora : High performance managed relational database with full MySQL and PostgreSQL compatibility SQL : Managed MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server Azure SQL : Migrate, modernize, and innovate on the modern SQL family of cloud databases
2. Amazon Aurora Serverless V2 : Instantly scale to >100,000 transactions per second Datastore : NoSQL database for your web and mobile apps Azure Cosmos DB : Build or modernize scalable, high-performance apps
3. Amazon DocumentDB (with MongoDB compatibility) : Fully managed document database Firestore : Serverless NoSQL document DB Azure SQL Database : Build apps that scale with managed and intelligent SQL database in the cloud
4. Amazon DynamoDB : Managed NoSQL database Spanner : Horizontally scalable relational DB Azure Database for PostgreSQL : Fully managed, intelligent, and scalable PostgreSQL
5. Amazon ElastiCache : In-memory caching service Bigtable : Petabyte-scale, low-latency, non-relational Azure SQL Managed Instance : Modernize SQL Server applications with a managed, always-up-to-date SQL instance in the cloud
6. Amazon Keyspaces (for Apache Cassandra) : Managed Cassandra-compatible database Memorystore : Managed Redis and Memcached Azure Database for MySQL : Fully managed, scalable MySQL Database
7. Amazon MemoryDB for Redis : Redis-compatible, durable, in-memory database that delivers ultra-fast performance Database Migration : Cloud SQL migrations simplified SQL Server on Azure Virtual Machines : Migrate SQL Server workloads to the cloud at lower total cost of ownership (TCO)
8. Amazon Neptune : Fully managed graph database service MongoDB Atlas : JSON-like data models, querying, & scaling Azure Cache for Redis : Accelerate apps with high-throughput, low-latency data caching
9. Amazon Quantum Ledger Database (QLDB) : Fully managed ledger database Neo4j Aura : Integrated, fully managed graph databases Azure Database Migration Service : Accelerate your data migration to Azure
10. Amazon RDS : Managed relational database service for MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, SQL Server, and MariaDB Redis Enterprise : Robust in-memory database platform Azure Managed Instance for Apache Cassandra : Modernize Cassandra data clusters with a managed instance in the cloud
11. Amazon RDS on Outposts : Automate on-premises database management AlloyDB : Enterprise-grade, PostgreSQL-compatible databases Azure Database for MariaDB : Deploy applications to the cloud with enterprise-ready, fully managed community MariaDB
12. Amazon Redshift : Fast, simple, cost-effective data warehousing
13. Amazon Timestream : Fully managed time series database
14. AWS Database Migration Service : Migrate databases with minimal downtime

Data Analytics Tools/Services
#

Sno Amazon Azure Microsoft
1. Amazon Athena : Query data in S3 using SQL BigQuery : Data warehouse for business agility and insights. Azure Synapse Analytics : Limitless analytics with unmatched time to insight
2. Amazon Cloud : SearchManaged search service Looker : Platform for BI, data applications, and embedded analytics. Azure Databricks : Design AI with Apache Spark™-based analytics
3. Amazon DataZone (Preview) : Unlock data across organizational boundaries with built-in governance Dataflow : Streaming analytics for stream and batch processing. Microsoft Purview : Govern, protect, and manage your data estate
4. Amazon OpenSearch Service : Search, visualize, and analyze up to petabytes of text and unstructured data Pub/Sub : Messaging service for event ingestion and delivery. Azure Data Factory : Hybrid data integration at enterprise scale, made easy
5. Amazon EMR : Easily run big data frameworks Dataproc : Service for running Apache Spark and Apache Hadoop clusters. HDInsight : Provision cloud Hadoop, Spark, R Server, HBase, and Storm clusters
6. Amazon FinSpace : Analytics for the financial services industry Cloud Data Fusion : Data integration for building and managing data pipelines. Azure Stream Analytics : Real-time analytics on fast-moving streaming data
7. Amazon Kinesis : Analyze real-time video and data streams Cloud Composer : Workflow orchestration service built on Apache Airflow. Azure Machine Learning : Build, train, and deploy models from the cloud to the edge
8. Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka : Fully managed Apache Kafka service Dataprep : Service to prepare data for analysis and machine learning. Azure Analysis Services : Enterprise-grade analytics engine as a service
9. Amazon Redshift : Fast, simple, cost-effective data warehousing Dataplex : Intelligent data fabric for unifying data management across silos. Azure Data Lake Storage : Scalable, secure data lake for high-performance analytics
10. Amazon QuickSight : Fast business analytics service Looker Studio : Interactive data suite for dashboarding, reporting, and analytics. Azure Data Explorer : Fast and highly scalable data exploration service
11. AWS Clean Rooms : Match, analyze, and collaborate on datasets–without sharing or revealing underlying data Analytics Hub : Service for securely and efficiently exchanging data analytics assets.
12. AWS Data Exchange : Find, subscribe to, and use third-party data in the cloud
13. AWS Data Pipeline : Orchestration service for periodic, data-driven workflows
14. AWS Glue : Simple, scalable, and serverless data integration
15. AWS Lake Formation : Build, manage, and secure your data lake

item.title: Model Garden of VertexAI
item.author: hari@dasarpai.com (Dr. Hari Thapliyaal)
item.description:
Model Garden of VertexAI:
#

Unlocking the Power of Google’s VertexAI: Exploring the World of Pre-Built Models for AI Tasks
#

Introduction:
#

Artificial Intelligence (AI) has transformed numerous industries, from healthcare and finance to e-commerce, logistic, eduction and entertainment. But the complexity of developing machine learning models often poses a challenge. As the demand for AI-powered solutions continues to rise, data scientists seek efficient ways to leverage pre-trained models or build custom models to address specific tasks. In this regard, Google’s VertexAI emerges as a robust platform that offers an extensive selection of pre-built models for a wide range of AI tasks. VertexAI platform has revolutionized the landscape by seamlessly leveraging LLM (Large Language Models) and Prompt Engineering techniques to perform complex machine learning tasks effortlessly. With VertexAI, data scientists can harness the power of state-of-the-art language models, such as LLM, to accelerate their ML development process. Additionally, the innovative concept of Prompt Engineering enables users to effectively communicate with the models, guiding them to deliver precise and accurate results. From computer vision and natural language processing to speech processing and structured tabular data analysis, Vertex AI’s repertoire includes over 100 models catering to diverse application domains. This article explores how Vertex AI, through its integration of LLM and Prompt Engineering, empowers users to effortlessly tackle intricate machine learning tasks across diverse domains, revolutionizing the AI development experience.

item.title: A Comprehensive Guide to 210+ AWS Services
item.author: hari@dasarpai.com (Dr. Hari Thapliyaal)
item.description:
A Comprehensive Guide to 210+ AWS Services
#

Exploring 210+ Cloud Services and Their Purposes
All these services are availalbe at Link

Introduction
#

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a suite of cloud computing services that runs on the same infrastructure that Amazon uses for its e-commerce website. AWS offers a broad set of global compute, storage, database, AI, analytics, application, and deployment services that help organizations move faster, lower IT costs, and scale applications.

item.title: Unlocking the Power of Azure- Exploring 300+ Cloud Services and Their Purposes
item.author: hari@dasarpai.com (Dr. Hari Thapliyaal)
item.description:
Unlocking the Power of Azure
#

Exploring 300+ Cloud Services and Their Purposes
All these services are availalbe at Link:

Introduction
#

Embracing the cloud has become an integral part of modern businesses, and Microsoft Azure stands out as a leading player in the realm of cloud computing. With a staggering portfolio of over 300+ cloud services, Azure offers a rich and diverse ecosystem to meet the ever-evolving needs of organizations across the globe. However, navigating through this extensive array of services can be a daunting task, as it is often challenging to grasp the purpose and potential of each offering. In this comprehensive guide, we aim to unravel the mysteries of Azure and shed light on the vast landscape of its cloud services. Join me on a journey of discovery as we explore, demystify, and showcase the range of Azure’s offerings, empowering you to make informed decisions and harness the full power of the Azure.

item.title: Google Cloud Service Catalog - A Comprehensive Overview of 250+ Google Cloud Services
item.author: hari@dasarpai.com (Dr. Hari Thapliyaal)
item.description:
Google Cloud Service Catalog
#

A Comprehensive Overview of 250+ Google Cloud Services
All these services are availalbe at Link

Introduction
#

In the ever-evolving landscape of cloud computing, Google Cloud entered recently compare to AWS and Azure. But it stands out as a prominent player, offering a vast array of services and solutions to empower businesses and developers. With over 250+ services available, navigating the expansive Google Cloud ecosystem can be a daunting task. However, understanding these services and their functionalities is crucial for harnessing the full potential of the platform and provide the right technical solution of any business problem. In this comprehensive guide, I will take you through the diverse landscape of Google Cloud services, shedding light on their purposes. Whether you are a seasoned cloud professional or new to the Google Cloud environment, this article aims to demystify the complexity and provide you with valuable insights into the extensive toolkit Google Cloud has to offer. You can bookmark this page for future reference.
